title: East Gippsland Victoria Tour
other_title: Australian Movie Magazine [East Gippsland Victoria Tour]
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Gippsland (Vic.) - Description and travel
abstract: Jump on board the Victorian Ministry of Tourism Press Bus for a swinging tour of East Gippsland!
description: 35 years after we fell in love with the beauty of ‘The Gippsland Lakes’ (1939), the delights of East Gippsland are once again on show. This time ‘round the soundtrack is more swinging and the poetry dialed back as we climb aboard the Victorian Ministry of Tourism's 'Press Tour' bus, to witness the region through the eyes of a mid-70's journo. We take in Mallacoota and Port Hicks before arriving in oil-country; the rigs and refineries of Sale having come a long way since the humble pipe-into-a-corrugated-tank proudly featured in 1939's travelogue. Back on board the bus, we are whisked off to the spectacular Buchan Caves – home to a host of delicate limestone formations. Our final stop on the tour is Lakes Entrance, where we trade in our wheels for a pair of wings, and a final spectacular view down 90 Mile Beach. Not bad for a day's work!
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002952; Regional Focus: Gippsland; Active; 2014
